citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Moored Sediment Trap Data - La Perouse, 1982-present

descript.abstract: Data from sediment traps moored at La Perouse Bank, at station P4 at a depth of 700m, from 1982-2000.
descript.purpose: Studying the biogeochemical flux between the deep ocean and the continental shelf.
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre. Risk of Loss: High Impact Justification: Long term time series (more than 10 years) Impact of Loss: High Recommended Action: Bring data to archives

idinfo.useconst: Recent data may be subject to proprietary retrictions to access.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.logic: For C:N, biogenic silicate, CaCO3: subsamples of one sample, collected at P26, are analyzed with each set of data to check for continuity. Zooplankton that likely swam into the trap are removed. Silicate concentrations are compared to prepared standards.
dataqual.complete: Dataset Complications: Some gaps in the data due to trap malfunction.

procstep.procdesc: Data collected in collaboration with reasearchers at UBC.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

stdorder.nondig: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y Hardcopy Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1408, IOS Hardcopy Description: Binders of data sheets, cruise reports Hardcopy Volume: about 4 2 in. binders Physical Sample Exists: Y Physical Sample Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1411, IOS Physical Sample Volume: several hundred Physical Sample Description: Vials of dried sediment in various formats: some are on filters, some are not. Physical Sample Complications: Some of the early biogenic silicate fractions were poorly labelled (several hundred).
stdorder.ordering: Data which have been published are to be made available.
Electronic Data Doc Locations: Header information in files Dataset Locations: IOS Climate chemistry shared hard drive

distinfo.techpreq: Backup by Custodian: Y Backup by Automation: Y Backup Description: 3 1/2 in. disks in binders containing data sheets.
